description.narrative: To improve communities' access to basic infrastructures and provide economic opportunities for vulnerable households in urban and rural areas, through: (a) a community driven approach; (b) a labor-intensive public works program; and (c) the provision of capacity-building at the community and local government levels.

condition.narrative: Mantain a FM system in accorance to General conditions
Prepare audit of LACE financial statements

title.narrative: Percent of project management expenses as part of total budgeted annual expenditures
Percentage of subprojects undertaken that reflect beneficiaries' priorities and implemented in collaboration with local authorities(Amendment to FA - 5i)

comment.narrative: IDA - 100% of the 80 subprojects identified reflect community priorities as verified through the PRA/CDD approachEU - 100% of 185subprojects identified reflect community priorities as verified through the PRA/CDD approach

title.narrative: Training: (a) Number of PMC members successfully trained yearly; (b) Number of county/district officials successfully trained everyyear

comment.narrative: These figures are cumulative training totals as all trainings under the Project have now been completed.

title.narrative: Completion of subprojects: (a) schools (b) markets (c) bridges (d) wells (e) health facilities
Organizational Capacity: Percentage of CBOs implementing sub-projects have a bank account where funds can be managed accountably under PMC (Amendment to FA # 5iii)
Percent of PMCs that are inclusive and at least 50% of their members are women (Amendment to FA # 5ii)
Improved Access to Basic Services (Amendment to FA - 5iv): Increase in the number of children attending primary school in "improved" facilities as defined by technical assessment
Organizational Capacity: Percentage of communes that have minutes of the meeting electing PMCs
Person-days of temporary jobs created (Amendment to FA # 5v)

comment.narrative: (NB. With the preparation of the OM, the overall number of person- days was reduced from 800,000 to 680,000 due to an increase inthe wage paid to workers from 2.5 to 3 US$ per day).

title.narrative: Percentage of targeted vulnerable households reporting increased income by at least 20%
